alert.note: Alert for Lower Kuskokwim Valley (Alaska) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Wind Chill Advisory issued January 22 at 3:03AM AKST until January 22 at 7:00PM AKST by NWS Anchorage
info.description: ...WIND CHILL ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 7 PM AKST THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Very cold wind chills. Wind chills as low as 45 below zero. North-northeast winds 15 to 25 mph. * WHERE...Lower Kuskokwim Valley. * WHEN...From 7 PM Sunday to 7 PM AKST Monday. * IMPACTS...The dangerously cold wind chills could cause frostbite on exposed skin in as little as 5 minutes. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...A cold Arctic air mass is in place over interior Alaska through the early week. This cold air paired with increased winds will result in wind chill values approaching -35F to -45F through this afternoon. Winds will decrease through today with wind chill values improving to -30F to -40F by Tuesday morning.
info.instruction: Use caution while traveling outside. Wear appropriate clothing, a hat, and gloves.
